Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Great Value
Reviews.Author: VegasJack
Reviews.Content: So far so good.... works better than advertised. Pictures are crystal clear, with the exception of a few caused by camera shake (me sneezing).. A very good product, would highly recommend it to friends. Kodak has a winner here. I purchased  the "Blue Bundle" (get more for less $$) and quite pleased with it so far.  I noticed a few reviews complaining of short battery life. I had the same problem, but found the fault was mine  for not fully charging the batteries the first time. Bought new batteries (same brand and type as what came with the camera), fully charged them, and presto, the battery drain rate was dramatically improved. Approximately 4 to 5 times longer than the first pair I managed to screw up. About 300 pictures before I had to give 'em a fresh shot of juice (electricity).A feature not mentioned in the ad is this camera does in fact have "5x Digital Zoom" in addition to the 3x optical zoom.I've had the camera just a few days, but have taken over 400 photos (mostly just junk shots learning about the camera and its settings) and have no complaints whatsoever. Camera seems to be very durable, body feels and looks like its made of metal/aluminum, it may be plastic, hard to tell as its so well constructed. Buttons are a tad small, but that turns out to be a plus, as with my other camera, I keep changing the settings as the buttons are "To Easy" to press. I like that the camera reverts back to the default "Auto" setting when turned off and back on again. Makes picture taking simple, just turn it on, point and shoot and get great shots with no fussing around with settings. The one issue, however minor, is when the batteries are removed or battery compartment is opened to remove memory card, you have to reset the clock. Not a big issue, just a minor annoyance. I'm retried, so I don't worry about time anyway..Also read a few complaints of poor picture quality with this model. The first few pictures I took were blurry and way out of focus. Problem was my fault (and may be that of others also) for not letting the camera focus. Press the button half way till the frame on the display turns green.... then snap and great pictures from there on out.. When problems arise, hit the Kodak web site, great resource for solving camera and picture problems.Setup is a snap, just plunk the batteries in (after they're charged of course), set the language, date and time.... point, shoot, and unlike a former Vice President, you won't miss that once in a lifetime perfect shot.... picture that is. Great camera for us older folks, who like me, don't quite yet grasp the digital age fully. Why I'd even recommend this to the ex-wife and her attorney.... for a small fee. (wink)Another  feature I like, is the built-in Help system. It describes every setting for every menu choice. If you learn nothing else about your camera, learn how to use the on-camera Help feature.

Reviews.Title: Decent, Easy to Use Camera
Reviews.Author: BrandyHoward
Reviews.Content: Love the large photo size (12 Meg) ...Downside, It is very simple.  Which is a possitive to many people.  Simply press half-way down, wait for it to fine tune the focus, push all the way down, and you have wonderful pictures.  It is not as simple as other cameras to adjust the settings to fine-tune photos, but overall a great, easy to use, camera.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for a Grandmother.
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my 70 year old mother.  She is not a professional photographer, but she is a grandmother.  This is perfect for her since it is so user friendly.  Each function of the camera is written out for her on the screen.  We are both very happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Easy Use
Reviews.Author: Lefty
Reviews.Content: After using countless point and shoot cameras over the years. This Kodak camera is by far the best yet. It's easy to use, great auto mode. And the flash is programable and doesn't wash out the picture. Nice large screen to view the pics. Kodak has a winner in this one.

Reviews.Title: KODAK has a hit!
Reviews.Author: Binary Spin
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent camera for the money. I am a little embarrassed to say the pics taken outside or in well lit indoor areas rival those of my $800 digital SLR. Flash pics also fine for subjects 6-8 feet away or closer, and surprisingly good macro shots. Has features normally associated with much higher priced point-and-shoots like in-camera editing, exposure bracketing, 3 frames/sec continuous shooting, face detection and switching between internal memory (32mb) and memory card - if card fills up, you can still get 7-8 shots by switching to internal memory. I like the fact that it takes AA batteries since they are easy to find in a fix. I can also use rechargeable AAs or lithium AAs, which seem to last forever. Nice bright screen and focuses well in moderately lit areas. Seems to be a sturdier build than previous Kodak entry level cameras (nowhere to go but up), and Easy Transfer system works well. Potential downsides for some users: 1-Can't hear sound on video playback until vids are transferred to computer (but vids are in AVI format, a plus for windows users). 2-If you're looking for high ISO low-light shots forget it...you won't get that from any camera within $100 of this price point. You can set the ISO to 1600 but you won't like the results. Forget the high ISO and use a tripod.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: BG
Reviews.Content: This is definitely a great camera for the price. I was sort of reluctant at first, because I bought this camera online, on sale and without trying it. The pictures that you see online don't really do it any justice, either. I'm pretty impressed, though.The only thing I could really complain about would be the battery life. 2 AAs only lasted me half a day (BUT keep in mind - I am very snap-happy), so I'm considering just buying rechargeable batteries.Over all, a wonderful investment for me and I couldn't be much happier with it.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera
Reviews.Author: melanie
Reviews.Content: I got this camera for a great deal. I love the color. I had read other reviews and was skeptical, but I'm glad I bought it! The screen is a great size and very bright. There are so many different options for taking pictures, such as a firework option, self portrait option, and flower option, among others. I haven't even explored them all. If you don't want to deal with all of the options though, there is a smart capture button that just switches to what the camera thinks is best. I haven't played around with the Share button yet and actually don't really care to use it. The only problem that I would say that I have with this camera is that the zoom isn't very good. I wish that it had more digital zoom, because most of the time it doesn't have any. Another, smaller complaint that I have, is that the camera just doesn't feel well made. It's light which is nice, but it feels much more plastic-y than my old HP camera.To address complaints that others had, the battery life really isn't bad. Use rechargeable batteries, they obviously work the best. Also, for those saying there isn't enough space on the camera to hold pictures or that they get lost, use an SD card. $13 at Best Buy and you can save thousands of pictures.Overall, this is a great purchase for the price for anyone who just wants to snap day to day photos.

Reviews.Title: Ease of operation
Reviews.Author: R. Corbett
Reviews.Content: Having bought my third digital camera this year. I chose this particlular model for it's features,affordability, and ease of use. It actually exceeded my expectations. Did some low light, non-flash pictures of orchids on the "close-up setting" and they were alot better quality than I was expecting. Of course it takes awhile to adjust to the buttons of any new device, but I learned the procedure very quickly. One tip, I went to the the kodak.com web-site and downloaded the software prior to recieving the camera and successfully installed it. When I hooked up the camera,,(through the included USB 2 cable) I let Windows install the drivers and then I went through the Kodak software configuration. I filled in all the boxes honestly and it directly conects to my Facebook and AOL accounts. Love the GUI (Graphical User Interface) for the Kodak software.It is a very smooth camera/software package and provides plenty of options.Kodak EasyShare C143 Digital Camera (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Incredible Value for Price!
Reviews.Author: L. Buehrer
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my fiancee for Christmas, and it was the perfect value for price!  She's a multimedia major, and absolutely LOVES the photo quality and all the customizable options.

Reviews.Title: Little Camera for the little moments
Reviews.Author: Y.A "Sakura112"
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy carrying this little camera around with me. Originally a gift from my bf, I thought it wouldn't be that impressive. However, I was really surprised at how responsive it is. Simple to use and best of all it doesn't confuse me with so many buttons. Want something simple? get this. I like to take a lot of different shots of everything I see and this is just the perfect companion for those of us who like to point and shoot. The only downside to this camera is the fact that it uses AA batteries, however my bf got me a pair of kodak's rechargeable batteries and kodak charger. Put them all together and it was just a perfect combination!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share C143
Reviews.Author: Billy Wayne Mattixkq
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son and me. It arrived right on time and in great condition. It is easy to work and provides great pictures and video. I will gladly recommend this camera to everyone.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: CincySid
Reviews.Content: Kodak EasyShare was very easy to use, the directions were easy to follow. i put a 4G chip in it and can take thousands of pictures. The pictures come out great and it is easy to set your photos from 1 megapixel to 12 megapixel with a simple change in your settings. Flash is simple, everything is so simple to use on this camera. you won't be disappointed and it is so cheap!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share lives up to its name
Reviews.Author: S. Gudmestad
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my autistic son to use on a trip.  After an afternoon of taking funny pictures of each other he got the hang of using it.  Teaching him how to put his pictures on the computer was easy.  His connection to the internet was a little lacking so I was unable to set it so his pictures post directly to Facebook but that is not the reason I bought the camera.  This lived up to it's review.  I've owned several Kodaks over the years and purchased this camera on the name.  I was not disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Marcy
Reviews.Content: This camera has a big viewing screen with very clear images. The camera is pretty easy to use and the pictures come out nice. They still look good when they are printed or uploaded. Storage space is good; you can adjust the number of megapixels for more storage. Like most digital cameras, the batteries drain after just a couple of uses, or at least after taking a lot of photos so you should always carry some extras.

Reviews.Title: Great inexpensive point and shoot
Reviews.Author: Allison & Bill Dunn "Alli"
Reviews.Content: I got this for my mom this year for mother's day.  I wanted something simple for her to use...if it's too complex, she won't bother.  We're up visiting her for summer vacation.  What a great little camera.  Takes wonderful pictures.  Has a small zoom, but she's mostly taking face pictures and group pics, so it's not a real issue.  There are a few things that make this a great little camera1) Great picture quality considering the price2) Uses AA batteries.  I have previously used Cannon's, and hate proprietary batteries.  You can't just "buy a battery" for one of those cameras if yours dies at an amusement park.  This uses common batteries. BIG TIME +++3) Simple controls4) Small enough to carry in your pocket.  It's not ultra-slim, but it's small enough.Overall, it's a great little camera for the inexpensive price-tag

Reviews.Title: Great value for money
Reviews.Author: Rahul
Reviews.Content: I wanted a camera that was inexpensive and took good quality pictures without me putting much effort into the process since I'm not a professional photographer. I was very happy with the picture quality. Apart from that, the camera looks good, is easy to operate, has a nice clear "preview" screen and doesn't require any fancy software to upload pictures onto the computer. It does come with some fancy options (like direct upload to Facebook) but I'm not interested in those and cannot comment on how they work. I have not used the camera long enough to comment on battery consumption but you can always purchase a pair of Kodak rechargeable batteries with a re-charging unit for about $8 on Amazon.com. I'd also recommend buying a camera case (I bought a Kodak hardcover case specifically for this model for about $3 on Amazon.com which fits perfectly). Go here if you wish to buy the same: Kodak EVA Hard Camera Case (Compatible: C143, C183, C195, SPORT, M1093 IS, M340, M341, M380, M381, M522, M532, M552, M580, M590, M575, M550, M530, MINI, TOUCH). Also purchase an external memory card (SD card) for use with the camera.The only noticeable flaw in my camera is that it makes a small continuous clicking noise when it's on. But I'm okay with that as long as it doesn't affect its operation.Verdict: Buy if you are looking for a good quality point-and-shoot camera at a competitive price.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT BUY!
Reviews.Author: DJ COOP
Reviews.Content: I have had a few point and shoot cameras in my day(double digits) and this is by far the best.  I am in the military and on deployment so i use this to capture scenery and many times action photos from combat aircraft and vehicles.  The clarity and the sharpness is extremely impressive. It is very easy to use and adjust the settings for night, motion, landscape etc and the results have been wonderful.  In fact after viewing my pictures on my laptop, many people in my unit are now purchasing the same camera.

Reviews.Title: My wife just loves this camera
Reviews.Author: Charles W. Gregory "Reviewer-Editor-Bookseller"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my wife, even though she didn't like the idea of keeping the images on a computer...she used to take great pictures but her film-based camera broke years ago. Once I showed her how easy this one was, and what great photos it took, she was hooked. She just loves it, and now she is taking great pictures again. Thanks Kodak.

Reviews.Title: Currently outdated but a great camera.
Reviews.Author: Kevon Walcott
Reviews.Content: I'm no photo buff. far from It. I bought this camera for my wife and she loves it. Photos are clear even in low light conditions. Best camera we've ever had, this doesn't say much since I'm no camera man, but if you want a simple point and shoot that takes great pictures you can't go wrong with this.

Reviews.Title: Love it, Great Camera
Reviews.Author: VegasJack
Reviews.Content: So far so good.... works better than advertised. Pictures are crystal clear, with the exception of a few caused by camera shake (me sneezing).. a very good product, would highly recommend it to friends... Kodak has a winner here.. I bought the "Blue Bundle" (cheaper and comes with case and charger) and quite pleased with it so far. After reading several reviews on this model (C143), I noticed reviews stating "Short Battery Life" - "Camera Drains Batteries To Quick" I had the same problem, but found it was my fault for not fully charging the batteries the first time. Bought new batteries (same brand and type as what came with the camera), fully charged them, and presto, the battery drain rate was dramatically improved. Approximately 4 to 5 times longer than the first pair I managed to screw up. About 300 pictures before I had to give 'em a fresh shot of juice (electricity).A feature not mentioned in the ad is this camera does in fact have "5x Digital Zoom"  in addition to the 3x optical zoom.I've had the camera for just a few days, but have taken over 400 photos (mostly just junk shots learning about the camera and its settings) and have no complaints whatsoever. Camera seems to be very durable, body feels and looks like its made of metal/aluminum, it may be plastic, hard to tell as its so well constructed. Buttons are a tad small, but it may be just my big fingers, not a big deal or a complaint. I like the fact that the camera reverts back to the default "Auto" setting when turned off and back on again. Makes picture taking simple, just turn it on, point and shoot and get great shots with no fussing around with the settings. The one issue, however minor, is when the batteries are removed or battery compartment is opened to remove memory card, you have to reset the clock. Not a big issue, just a minor annoyance. I'm retried, so I don't worry about time anyway..Also read a few complaints of poor picture quality with this model. The first few pictures I took were blurry and way out of focus. Problem was my fault (and may be that of others also) for not letting the camera focus. Press the button half way till the frame on the display turns green.... then snap and great pictures from there on out.. When problems arise, hit the Kodak web site, great resource for solving camera and picture problems.Setup is a snap, just plunk the batteries in (after they're charged of course), set the language, date and time.... point, shoot and unlike Dick Cheney, you won't miss that perfect shot.... picture that is. Great camera for us older folks, who like me, don't quite yet grasp the digital age fully. Why I'd even recommend this to the ex-wife and her attorney.... for a small fee. (wink)A feature I like, is the built-in Help system. It describes every setting for every menu choice. If you learn nothing else about your camera, learn how to use the on-camera Help feature.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: johned
Reviews.Content: its a simple, easy to use, camera. The features and the zoom on it make it a great buy. Still learning how to use everything on it but to far im in love. Great Buy.

Reviews.Title: Very good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Mulkurul
Reviews.Content: Good pictures, nice distribution of light even with flashlight and, in poor conditions of light, increasing the light compensation through the "program" function gets the job done. Pictures are by far better than more expensive cameras I've tried. Alkaline or rechargeable batteries last a lot with this camera. Good purchase, no regrets!

Reviews.Title: Impressive camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Shelby
Reviews.Content: Best camera i've ever had, and super easy to use.I have a one year old son, and taking decent pictures hasn't always been easy due the the fact that he's ALWAYS on the go.I've never had a fuzzy, distorted picture with this camera.No regrets on this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great camera at a good price!
Reviews.Author: Mumsy
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera for my daughter so she would stop using mine!  She loves the color and the ease of use.  It's very simple and takes great pictures!  You can't beat the price either!  I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easy Share C143 Digital Camera
Reviews.Author: Andre S. Morariu "andresor9"
Reviews.Content: Nice purchase.Just like described.Great price for a brand new camera.Very easy to understand the camera's operational modes right out of the box. I recomend this one even if it has only 12 mp it still gets great quality pics.

Reviews.Title: Daughter Loves It
Reviews.Author: R. Harris
Reviews.Content: We bought the camera for my 12 year old daughter and she is delighted with its performance.  She says the battery life is good and it does exactly what she wants in a camera.  We're both happy, since the price was fairly low and the quality appears to be better than satisfactory.  I would definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: c143
Reviews.Author: Edwin Clifton
Reviews.Content: nice little camera so far , easy to use. if your looking for something to carry around for some quick shots of your friends this is much better than a phone camera .

Reviews.Title: Kodak C143
Reviews.Author: Warren
Reviews.Content: Works good out of the box. I just started taking pictures and some came out great and some came out so-so. I'll have to read the online (on the Internet) manual to figure how to make all the pictures come out great. [Also, there is an extensive pdf manual that can be  downloaded.] This is a great camera for the price. You can calculate the life of the 2 AA batteries by how many pictures you snap, not by how long they've been in the camera. The only con I can think of is that the lens will come out but will not always go back in when you turn the camera off. That makes it impossible to put it into the case that I bought.

Reviews.Title: As other reviews say this is a simple point and shoot camera
Reviews.Author: D. Roberts "guitarman42"
Reviews.Content: Ive gotten a few blurry pics out of a bunch but was mostly my fault not keeping a steady hand or just shooting with the wrong setting in the wrong light. This rivals my little ge a1455 14 mp. Much better color. I think my best pics come from scene mode and just picking the lighting situation you are in at the time.Auto is great also. for such a cheap camera this delivers sharp pictures any one can shoot. There is settings that allow you more control but this is basically a point and shoot no worry kinda camera with great results. Very compact also. The more kodaks I use the more I like kodak.

Reviews.Title: neet little package
Reviews.Author: Robert Emery "sai"
Reviews.Content: I've been enjoying my little Kodak EasyShare C143, as I am a grandfather of 3, it's ease of use enables me to just turn on aim and shoot those special moments.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Hickman
Reviews.Content: We have owned this camera for about 1.5 years and it works great as the day it was new.  It takes great 12MP pictures.  It has a nice assortment of setup options and the menu structure is easy to navigate.  The 2 AA batteries last pretty long but take an extra set with you just in case.  My now 11 year old daughter is the primary user of this camera.  She likes it too.

Reviews.Title: Wow...what a camera
Reviews.Author: jrhelsel
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat this camera for the price.  We bought it on a whim when our Olympus camera broke.  Kodak is truly a reliable company.  My husband recently dropped this in a creek and after drying it out in front of the truck defroster it is still working and the SD card is still working great.  Would recommend this camera absolutely!!!

Reviews.Title: So far, I'm happy w/this little camera!
Reviews.Author: P. Bowen "ImATXAggie"
Reviews.Content: I got this so I'd have a camera handy for those random "Kodak Moments" our kids so often have. It was something I bought that I could toss in my purse/diaper bag - and so far it's been GREAT.I wish I had paid more attention to the description. This camera only has 3x zoom; I'm used to my bigger/bulkier camera and it's 10x zoom, but...1) that's *MY* fault for not paying closer attention2) it's something I can get used to & live withThe one thing this does that my big camera doesn't? Zoom while video recording. I still take my big camera out & about; but this little guy doesn't take up as much room, and like I said, it's been great to "grab & snap."While I like the "bundle," I actually bought an inexpensive hard sided case (one of those things that Amazon recommends when you shop for/buy something)... I use the blue one as a coin purse and the hard case for the camera.I think my total purchase price was around $67, and so you'll get no complaints from me!*note: I've only had this for about a month. I've not figured out everything this camera can/can't do. I rotate rechargeable batteries regularly: always 1 set to use, 1 set to spare in the charger - so I can't really speak to the battery life, as I don't let it get to be a problem. (sorry) As for durability; it holds up being used by a 4yr old more than me, so, I'd say it's pretty durable! :)

Reviews.Title: This is a great camera.
Reviews.Author: M. Montgomery "Monty"
Reviews.Content: This camera has way more features then the book says that comes with it. The book is almost useless anyway.Once you get in to the camera you don't need the book. The pictures are great looking, it's hard not to take a good picture. Videos aren't bad as long as you don't use zoom, videos get a little noisy.I've had this camera just over a month, and no problems.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Gift
Reviews.Author: BlackAnt
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my little sister for her birthday. She really wanted a green camera and this is the best color our there!

Reviews.Title: Good value for the money
Reviews.Author: KR-Ohio
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera for our 10 year old daughter, as a first camera. She read through the brief instructions and has been using it with good success. Picture quality for printing has not been tested/used yet. Instructions that come in the box is limited, for more detailed instructions you need to go online to [...]

Reviews.Title: Keiths 10th B-Day Present
Reviews.Author: Judy
Reviews.Content: He just loves it.This was his 10th Birthday. He said it was his best present and he is turning into a great photographer.

Reviews.Title: prg
Reviews.Author: Philip R. Gille
Reviews.Content: The camera worked fine for a year.  I have owned the camera a little over a year and the camera froze with the lens out.  I have tried everything I can think of to fix it.  I looked on the site and was directed to send it in and have it repaired. On an inexpensive item like this I will not waste my money with a repair. I emailed question and have not received a reply.  I will buy a different product. I am very displeased. prg

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Trogers
Reviews.Content: I used my camera on a regualr basis and need something that can do everyday use. This stands up to everyday use and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: great buy for a good price!
Reviews.Author: J. Rodriguez "Sweet 17"
Reviews.Content: Before I owned this camera I had a Kodac c142 with 10 mp which lasted a long time and took great pictures with great resolution. Unfortunately my 2 year old broke it. I looked for another one since it was cheap and was a great camera but couldn't find more for sale on another popular website but lucky me I found it a Amazon at a great price.It takes the same quality pictures as my other DSLR camera and I take it everywhere with me and use it to take pictures for products I sell over the internet and it takes excellent pictures showing great detail on the image. Pictures as good enough as my professional DSLR camera.I would buy more if I could but Kodak is not making anymore products :(Buy it! Buy it! Battery life is excellent! That is also one of the reason I love and uses regular  2AA batteries!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding pictures
Reviews.Author: Marcus Twin
Reviews.Content: Small package, easy to use.  Pictures are terrific.  Bought this one for my ten year old daughter, but now the whole family uses it.

Reviews.Title: adult approved and kid tested
Reviews.Author: shell
Reviews.Content: I picked this out for my daughters 10th brithday last year. I have liked the quality of pictures as well if not better than any of my cameras which include an olympus and a cannon and she has a very easy time using it and it has stood up for a year now with no problems. Her sister now wants one for her birthday and the only thing I am not happy about is that the camera "package" (includes charger, case, etc.) that I purchased on amazon last year is harder to find and higher in price. I would definitely buy this again but I will also consider other Kodak easy share models if I can find the package nicely priced and similar features (expecting similar quality since I would be staying in kodak easy share branding).

Reviews.Title: good camera for its purpose
Reviews.Author: Christopher M. Buresch "crohnkiller"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for a portable digital camera. Mostly happy with everything. Sometimes pictures come out blurry no matter how still I hold myself. But for a camera to stick in our vehicle for when we go out as a family, this camera serves its purposes

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Mom of 2
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for my son's 4th birthday.....yes, that's right, he's only 4! I love taking pictures, of course I have a much more expensive camera, but both of my boys enjoying taking pictures too. We wanted a good camera for not allot of money, because remember he's only 4 and he will drop it! The camera really takes good pictures and it's easy to use. We've had this camera now for almost a year. Still working wonderfully and yes it's even been dropped!Great camera for the money!

Reviews.Title: Great Starter Camera
Reviews.Author: Skip Miller
Reviews.Content: After some research, I selected this camera for my eight year old daughter as her first "real" camera. we're all very happy with the relative ease of use and image quality. I was slightly disappointed to discover after getting started with the camera that there is no speaker for playback review of video, which is a draw back if you don't realize your expected audio is too loud or too soft. However, for the price, we are quite satisfied with this item.

Reviews.Title: Kodak Camera, Green
Reviews.Author: upchurb
Reviews.Content: I LOVE THIS CAMERA !!!  I have several other Kodak cameras and this is just as good as the Kodak name.  I can put this smaller camera in my purse and be able to snap pictures whenever I want.  I received this just in time for my granddaughter's 3rd birthday and was excited to be able to take a ton of Kodak memories.  I also love the video feature, as the same as on my other digital camera, and was able to film the entire birthday cake scene.  Also, the use of AA batteries is wonderful. I use the rechargeable batteries, as included with my camera and a recharger too.  I can change the batteries out quickly and have no need to use a special charger to recharge the batteries.  I also can use my data card thingy that holds up to 1,000 pictures.  I hear they make larger ones too,  BUY THIS CAMERA NOW !!!  KODAK IS STILL THE GODFATHER OF PHOTOGRAPHY FOR THE LITTLE PEOPLE THAT DON'T WANT THE TECHINAL MUMBOJUMBO !!!!  Oh, and the green color ROCKS !!!

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C143 Review
Reviews.Author: Mark Rieves
Reviews.Content: Ordered this camera while in Afghanistan and it arrived in about a week.  Have taken many pictures with it so far and all are excellent quality.  It is compact and fits in my shoulder pocket.  Comes with all needed accessories to include a soft case and rechargeable batteries.  Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Great pictures for a P&S;
Reviews.Author: immacoconut
Reviews.Content: Bought one of these for my fiancee and took it on trips and got great pictures so bought another one for his mom for her birthday. She had never had a digital camera and this was simple enough for her to figure out ad take great pictures!

Reviews.Title: Great lil camera
Reviews.Author: Hedgehog's mom
Reviews.Content: Bought this as a gift for my partner to take pics of her grandson...she wanted to be able to post on Facebook so all the relatives could see. Images are really nice, clear. The adjustable flash and one touch upload were the selling points for me and am not disappointed with it at all. Unexpected bonus, came with rechargeable batteries and a charger that plugs directly into the outlet like an air freshener. Sa-weet. Great lil camera, great! deal, Amazon made me look like a rock star. Ps~get the four gig SD card, good buy as well.

Reviews.Title: kodak easy share camera
Reviews.Author: marcia brown
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a small camera that was easy to use and this fits the bill. Batteries that came with the camera only lasted one day (a few hrs)and I thought that the camera was broken but after replacing the batteries it has worked fine. You do have to be careful with the battery cover as it sometimes does not fit that well. All and all a nice camera for the money.

Reviews.Title: An awesome camera
Reviews.Author: Carl B. Knudsen "razzyz"
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, has everything I want on it and is easy to use.Kodak EasyShare C182 Digital Camera (Blue)

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare Camera
Reviews.Author: S. Reaves
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome.  Shipped quickly so we were able to take it on vacation.  It was easy to use and takes great pictures.  We love it!!

Reviews.Title: VERY good - VERY happy.
Reviews.Author: erinsan
Reviews.Content: Obviously this is a basic point and shoot. It's a very inexpensive camera - but it works beautifully. It takes pictures that are crisp and clear.I have a 2yo, and sometimes lugging out the big Nikon DSLR just isn't easy. I love this for just slipping in the back pocket of my jeans. And if it breaks? I'm not going to be heart broken.For the price, you really can't beat it. I have NO complaints. I'm very, very happy with this camera!

Reviews.Title: Best Camera
Reviews.Author: Deliah15
Reviews.Content: For the price, this camera is outstanding.  It take beautiful pictures, and the flash makes it possible to take great pictures in any lighting.  It focuses well, and the electric blue color made everyone ask where I purchased it from.  I tell everyone AMAZON.  The prices are unbeatable, and it got to me in no time.  This camera should not be dropped and with a set of rechargeable batteries, it's good to go.  Also needs a memory card, but those are very cheap.  I had it for nearly a year and I use it all the time, and it still is working perfectly.  The recordings are even good, nothing like a professional camera, but once again, for the price, better than expected.

Reviews.Title: Easy Share So Easy
Reviews.Author: L. Carlisle
Reviews.Content: Pretty much plug it into your computer and it sets itself up.  Then you can send pics as you wish wihtout having to take out the SD card or plug it into your computer!

Reviews.Title: Anyone can use it!!!
Reviews.Author: mho
Reviews.Content: This camera is worth the money and easy to use.  Even a monkey can be trained to take photos of the beautiful planet Earth.  Reliable, not that ugly, and not too many buttons to confuse you... however, Kodak made a huge mistake.  There is no battery pack!!  For a modern 12mp camera, you have to waste your money buying 2 AA batteries and then wasting more time switching them out!  What a DRAG!

Reviews.Title: Battery cover fails easily
Reviews.Author: A. Lukas
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter and it takes perfectly fine photos.  It's easy to use but advanced enough for most casual applications.  But -- and I consider this a big "but"-- the battery cover is held closed by only a tiny sliver of plastic.  If you drop this thing even once, or even lightly bang it wrong on the table, there is a high probability this piece of plastic will snap and the battery cover will not stay closed any longer.  It seems absurd to have the correct functioning of the camera hanging on such a flimsy, easily breakable component.  I would have given the camera five stars except for this rather serious flaw.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Paul Crabtree
Reviews.Content: After six months' decent service this camera died today, for no reason. It is a completely unreliable, worthless piece of junk.

Reviews.Title: No battery life!
Reviews.Author: Danno30008
Reviews.Content: I liked this camera at first and the photo quality was good. I also saw some reviews before I bought the camera about the short battery life...Unfortunately they were correct. I actually followed the directions and let the batteries get a full charge before putting them in the camera.. Less than 1 hour after inserting them into the camera they were DOA. So I put in some new Die Hards and guess what? About 45 minutes later they were DOA too. This was a pain because we were on a short vacation and had to take the batteries out of the camera every time we were done with using it. So, it is being sent back to Amazon and I am getting a new Olympus that is quite a bit more expensive. If you get this camera, good luck and I hope you have a better experience than I did.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: T. Ogaard
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera. The pictures are crystal clear. My only concern is with the flash. I took a picture of my daughter and the color was great except the flash was so bright that it made her face grey scale. Every drop of color was sucked out of her face, so the picture looks quite strange. I'm not quite sure why, but I'm sure it was something that I did wrong and not a problem with the camera.

Reviews.Title: okay
Reviews.Author: lynn
Reviews.Content: photos come out great or terrible there is never any middle ground. kodak has quit supporting this product so the easy share feature has not been updated. i deleted it by accident and its impossible to reinstall.

Reviews.Title: Broke inside the unopened package
Reviews.Author: Reagan Kaiser
Reviews.Content: This camera was broken from the instant I opened it, and I opened it carefully. Never got the chance to use it.

Reviews.Title: Our first digital camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Riggs
Reviews.Content: This was a fairly easy camera to learn to use, a little inconsistent in picture quality (maybe due to the operator!)  It really got a lot of use, then the little battery cover broke.  Takes good videos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera except for the battery replacements
Reviews.Author: Charles G.
Reviews.Content: The camera comes with a 3.1 volt battery. When you purchase a replacement rechargeable battery from anyone (even Kodak) it's a 2.7 volt battery which only lasts for a few photos before. it needs recharging. I have a newer Kodak and ran into the same situation again. The camera itself is great.

Reviews.Title: My Kodak
Reviews.Author: marjea56
Reviews.Content: I am a photo junkie and this little camera takes great pictures and it's simple to use . It also records video with sound .

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Martha Russell "Martha Russell"
Reviews.Content: When I bought this camera it was because it was easy to use and priced right, I was replacing a similar camera that someone needed more than me, so they took it. I liked that it was bright blue because it is easy to spot no matter where I put it down. The camera itself is really easy to use, something that I find difficult to find in the stores. Since I do not use a camera often, I did not want something that I had to re-lean each time I used it and I don't want to spend $100+ for a once in three years usage. Very simple,that's what Iike.

Reviews.Title: Nice tiny camera!
Reviews.Author: Gentle reader
Reviews.Content: I have been surprised over and over at the quality of the pictures, and love how easy it is to download them.  Fast to learn to use, handy, indoors or out.  With the hard case, a great buy.

Reviews.Title: Easyshare software is junk!
Reviews.Author: muffiemae
Reviews.Content: ...which makes the camera junk. My software no longer works. I have uninstalled and reinstalled it, but it still doesn't work. Now there's no way I can upload the pictures from my camera to my computer. Kodak's "help" on their web site is useless. I won't buy a Kodak product again.

Reviews.Title: Kodak camera
Reviews.Author: alex
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my mother and she loved it. It is very simple to use and it couldn't have been a better Christmas gift.

Reviews.Title: Great for a starter camera.
Reviews.Author: Andrew Kline
Reviews.Content: My daughter wanted a camera for her birthday.  We chose this one based on reviews and we found that it did surprisingly well for the price we paid.  Grab yourself a nice SD card and you're good to go.  It's good for a starter camera.  I suggest you get a case with anything, so this shouldn't be any different.

Reviews.Title: YESSSS!!
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: My last camera like this broke when I dropped it.  This was same one and works as great as the last one!!  Love this and as normal all amazon's stuff comes super fast in the mail.  I love this site for great deals and comes fast!!

Reviews.Title: Kodak Easyshare is a great camera.
Reviews.Author: Katie Howell
Reviews.Content: Beautiful pictures even on automatic, but you can set it up any way you want.  Very effective and well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: very disappointed !!
Reviews.Author: D Verst
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera with the bundle - seemed like good deal.  Not happy with video features.When I went to review recorded video I found there was no sound playback.  Other camera I had allowedme to hear what I had recorded without having to download to computer.  Liked the features andsettings,  the panoramic feature was a good one and the option to use vivid color - made for somenice shots.  But now the battery cover wont latch and it wants me to reset the date every time Iturn it on -wastes precious moments that keep me from getting the quick shots I need.  So disappointedwith this camera.  Wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Product was a used piece of junk!!!!
Reviews.Author: Terry Allee
Reviews.Content: The product was suppose to be new, but was used and did not work.  I gave it to my mother as a gift and it was a very disappointing birthday.  It would not even come on much less take pictures.  The memory card was so used the label was worn off and the screen was scratched.  I will never use this seller again!

Reviews.Title: amazing photos
Reviews.Author: ingsoc413
Reviews.Content: Bought the Samsung WiFi camera Bought and it was very disappointing, even worse in low light.THis little Kodak is amazing. With poor lighting, the images came out great, better than my point and shoot Canon and way way better than our new Samsung, which could take a good snap to save its life.

Reviews.Title: A wonderful little camera
Reviews.Author: Scottyboy
Reviews.Content: This is the best little camera I've ever had.  It does it all, and does it very well.  The simplicity of use is the real joy.

Reviews.Title: Great! A camera that worked for 2.5 months!
Reviews.Author: A Customer
Reviews.Content: I took this camera on a trip to Canada and it did really well the entire trip. After the trip I try to review the pictures, as we always do on trips--all day, almost after each photo and it says "MUST REFORMAT MEMORY CARD, THIS WILL ERASE ALL PHOTOS". Hmm. I decide to NOT reformat the memory card and lose all my pictures. Thank Goodness! But now, no matter what memory card I put in the camera, the camera can not read the memory card. It still takes pictures on its internal memory but the internal memory only hold 12 pictures, so on most ventures it's pretty useless. Also had issues connecting the camera to the computer and quickly getting the pictures off of the camera. This process usually takes 30 minutes with all the icky kodak product BS. But there is also the option of taking the USB card out of the camera and slipping it into to memory card slot that may or may not be on your computer/printer, friend's computer/printer. Overall I give this a 2 out 5 for getting me through 4/5th of my Canadian trip. The stupid camera worked only 2.5 months.

Reviews.Title: Review of Kodak C143
Reviews.Author: SD
Reviews.Content: Great camera for everyday non-professional pictures, takes great pictures, good zoom, light weight, and you get a charger & case with this bundle.

Reviews.Title: Easyshare
Reviews.Author: khagprice
Reviews.Content: Everything is good except it only keeps 7 pictures at a time. Be sure to buy a card with it. Otherwise, it's great!

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Goerg
Reviews.Content: I got this for my son's 8th birthday.  He has been responsible with other electronics and is really into photos so we started with this one.  It is easy to use and takes awesome pictures. Coming with the case and charger just made it even more perfect.  I would recommend this for all your general photo taking.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.. I wish it were....
Reviews.Author: Southernreign "SR"
Reviews.Content: I think this is a great camera for the price. I bought this camera for my 8 year old son...He wants to be a "catagropher" He has been very careful with it. But the Battery compartment lid broke during battery change outs. The plastic latch did not hold up to my son openning and closing for even one day. Now it is taped closed. Works great otherwise... it takes beautiful pictures inside and out. I will review in a few months to see how it holds up to his abuse. I would buy again, even after the broke latch. Amazon prime delivered in less than two business days!

Reviews.Title: Good one
Reviews.Author: Daywalker
Reviews.Content: Bought it as a gift for the workplace. cant really complain as i dont use it personally. Looks bulky and honestly you can fin other brands which are sleeker and have more features. Quality of pictures are excellent and so is the value for money.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: Patricia Haskey "Michelle"
Reviews.Content: The camera is easy to use and takes great pictures.  Very happy with my zoom shots as well as the close ups.  Simple instructions on the camera so not a of time spent trying to figure out what I want it to do.

Reviews.Title: Love It!!!!!
Reviews.Author: lovely lady
Reviews.Content: This camera is great for the price. The share button was a bonus becuase I didn't know it was there. I can easliy uplaod pics all at once to my facebook page.

Reviews.Title: Pretty darn good!
Reviews.Author: nitnat84
Reviews.Content: Got this for my husband, cause he is on cruise in the middle east.. works great..excelent pictures.. great price!! I would def. recommend and the price was crazy good!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Stealth
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome, very easy to use, and very clear photos. Batteries that came with it were garbage, but whatever.. your paying for the camera! Though this was $50 when I bought it...

Reviews.Title: Kodak
Reviews.Author: Z
Reviews.Content: The Kodak camera seems to be ok, and you get what you pay for!  Our truck drivers use them, and so it's like apes using them..

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Erika Brown
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera to take pictures of my new granddaughter. size is perfect, pictures are great, camera is so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: The Camera was just okay
Reviews.Author: Brmetzger
Reviews.Content: I was a little disappointed with the Kokak Easyshare C143.  I bought it for my grandson and I found it to be a little flimsy, not as sturdy as I would have liked.  I did buy it at a good price, though.  Hopefully it will last him for awhile.  It does take good quality pictures and nice videos.

Reviews.Title: Good and Inexpensive Camera
Reviews.Author: W. Gardner
Reviews.Content: This Kodak camera is a good and inexpnsive camera that takes very good pictures.  Problem with all these cameras is that if one is a man with large hands, it is about impossible to push the tiny buttons to review pics, set settings, etc.  Also the software that it wants to download the first time the USB is plugged into the computer is not impressive.  But overall, a good buy for the money.

Reviews.Title: Memory card wouldn't work.
Reviews.Author: Chris "kouroo"
Reviews.Content: I bought the recommended memory card for this camera, the Kodak SDHC 4 gb.  The camera would not format the card.  It took me through an endless loop of 'format card' and 'can't recognize card', so I tried an old memory card from another camera, and it did the same thing.  Camera is not much use if you can only take 8 pictures on the internal memory.

Reviews.Title: nice camera
Reviews.Author: smylee
Reviews.Content: This camera, is light weight, small in size, and easy to use.  Just what we needed to send out on the job with our men.  Great value.

Reviews.Title: just right for a first camera
Reviews.Author: John Wally "Jack of all trades"
Reviews.Content: This camera was a gift for our 12 year old and it's just right. Jusr the right features plus video and a nice case. Thanks

Reviews.Title: satisfied
Reviews.Author: Alton Jones
Reviews.Content: very please with this product.I am very satisfied could not be any happier.I would recommend this products highly.Very please and satisfied

Reviews.Title: Excellent little P&S; camera
Reviews.Author: Ashwani Kumar
Reviews.Content: Easy to use, and takes excellent pictures. Bargain at this price and size.Intuitive interface. Was hesitant to purchase because of the rechargeable AAs,but so far happy with the supplied batteries and charger.Clicked away all day, and battery held up, then charged over night for next day.

Reviews.Title: Where have you been all my life!!
Reviews.Author: Monica L. Patton
Reviews.Content: I love this camera! I am tech challenged and this beautiful thing was just what I needed...open box, point and shoot! My husband who is a tech geek loved it as well and the price was ridiculously cheap!!!

Reviews.Title: Broke after 5 months and little use
Reviews.Author: W. Arsenault
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my son for Christmas; he is nine years old.  He was very excited and did take some pictures initially.  I have to tell you I have a BFA in photography and had a tough time figuring out the 'easy share'  LOL!!!  Because we did not want to share it with social media.  Once we got it worked out though, it was fine.  The quality of the pictures is OK, but not great by any means (you get what you pay for).  I was looking for a simple/basic camera for him that that is what this is.  Not surprisingly he has hardly used it, only a few times between christmas and now (May).  BUT, this past weekend we recharged the batteries since he wanted to take some pictures.  I was reinstalling them in the camera when a little piece snapped off of the bottom of the camera.  Now the battery door will not close & the camera is useless.  : (  We've tried duct taping the door shut but that will only last us so long.  So, this is a very cheaply made camera .  I would NOT recommend it and would not buy it again.  For a few more dollars you could get a much nicer camera with many more features.  My son is heartbroken.

Reviews.Title: Great Digital Camera!
Reviews.Author: Gabriel
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It's got some great features and it takes great high resolution photos. The photos are very clear. The picture quality is excellent. You can easily transfer the photos to your PC with the supplied cable and software. The color is beautiful. I love blue. It's my favorite color and it looks great. The case is very nice and handy. My only complaint is that this camera eats up batteries really fast. This is where the rechargeable battery pack comes in. This is a must because these batteries will last longer than the regular ones. Aside from that I definitely recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera..........
Reviews.Author: John Cocktoasten "Ben Sumner is the best! Ple...
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera for 3 months. I love it. Its portable, great focus, memory card is interchangable, cool color, flash works perfect, and most importantly, its easy for others to use when you want them to take a quick picture. Uncomplicated is the name of the game for this camera and it excels at it on every level. The software for Kodak is quick to install on your PC and pictures can be downloaded with ease. Highly recommend this EasyShare! This is my second Kodak (lost the first one) and I would absolutely buy another! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: Good pics
Reviews.Author: ReyFact
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for a good friend, he did like it and he sent me some very nice pics, that was a good deal for the price and quality.

Reviews.Title: Broke after 6 months -Never worked quite right in the 1st place
Reviews.Author: WNC
Reviews.Content: I love Kodak cameras!! My 1st digital camera that I bought 12 years ago was a Kodak. I am in real esate and use my digital camera everyday.  My previous low end priced Kodak lasted over two years (at least 10,000 pics) before it starting having some problem. That is two years of taking tons of pictures, being lugged around in and out of the car and back to the office.This one has problems from the start.  It is very slow to recyle to take a new picture (I have set on 3MP which is all I need for work).  You have to wait for the photo preview to go away to take another picture.  If you don't it will take a blank picture then you have to wait for that photo preview to go away to take another one.  The other big issue is the photo mode sensor.  Mine liked to think that everything was a close up shot.  Which looked perfectly fine on the camera display but the full size photo is very blurry.  You have to look at the icon the screen before taking a picture and wait for the flower icon to disappear or take several pics and hope that one comes out right.  Finally the battery door broke just enough not to stay closed anymore.  I was able to correct that problem with a tight rubberband.  I don't know if I got a dud or if this model line bad.  I have had too many good Kodaks to switch brands, but say to anyone to pass on buying this one model. BTW I am replacing this camera with a Kodak 1550.

Reviews.Title: Defective lens cover
Reviews.Author: Janet Dreyer
Reviews.Content: This camera is very flimsey. When inserting batteries one must be very careful with the lightweight latch.I think it could break very easily. My lens cover, at least the top half , has disappeared. It is just gone. I need my camera for an upcoming vacation or I would return it. The pictures are clear and crisp. I am not happy with how quickly the batteries are used up.

Reviews.Title: Nice little camera
Reviews.Author: aunt ruth
Reviews.Content: I decided to purchase a economical digital camera to take pictures to put on my Kodak Easy Share frame.I thought of Kodak because my frame was Kodak. I was very pleased that the pictures really turned out wonderful. I got the best price and the best service from Amazon Be ready to get the case. I did not do but Amazon showed me what I missed. I then ordered and still got the best price and service to my door in a few days.

Reviews.Title: C My Kodak I(1) Love(4) You(3)
Reviews.Author: BunnyGenny
Reviews.Content: Me and my brother just love our Kodak! It is my first Camera gift to my brother Bunny and he loves it! We get all the best pictures and moments that we want to freeze and laugh at. The picture and color quality is excellent for its price, hands and eyes down on that issue. It is very light weight and easy to carry. It is extremely stylish and sleek! We are so much happy that our first purchase from Amazon clicked!

Reviews.Title: great replacement
Reviews.Author: Sheila J. Bowen
Reviews.Content: I misplaced my first Easyshare and ordered another as a replacement .love this camera as it is so simple to use and is affordably priced

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: R. Sachs
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed getting this camera in a timely manner and it takes great pictures.  I'm not a professtional or a camera buff, but I enjoy taking pictures of my new puppy.

Reviews.Title: Kodak EasyShare C143 12 MO Digitak Camera w/ 3x Optical Zoom (Blue Bundle)
Reviews.Author: Dolores Worrell "seaoats"
Reviews.Content: I received the camera yesterday and printed my return label to ship it back to Amazon.  After reading many of the reviews I decided that this camera is too cheaply made and I opted for the Canon PowerShot ELPH 100 HS 12.1 MP CMOS Digital Camera with 4X Optical Zoom.  I tried to cancel the Kodak Easyshare camera with 18 hours but it wouldn't let me.

Reviews.Title: Flash Does Not work
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: My 10 year old daughter saved and saved to buy this camera.  About two weeks after owning it, we realized the flash did not work and probably never did (she was taking pictures outside when she first received it).  I chatted online with Kodak and now have to send the camera in for repair.  Very, very disappointed in Kodak.  I expected more from this company.  Doing a Google search showed me that this is a problem others have had with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Quite a Value
Reviews.Author: Laaurence W. Michalski "tantumergo"
Reviews.Content: The software would not install and the printed directions were virtually useless.  I did a live chat with one of the Kodak customer service techs and we spent the better part of a very frustrating hour trying to download the necessary software.  At one point I was about ready to give up and determined it would be better just to return the camera for a refund than to continue.But finally, everything fell in place.  With the exception of the poor quality of pictures in low light ambiance, I am rather pleased with the results and I am glad I did not throw in the towel.BTW the product info published by Amazon should have advised that the camera came with only limited internal memory and that a card should be purchased.  tsk! tsk! Amazon!

Reviews.Title: Can't use rechargeable batteries :-(
Reviews.Author: eric_the_redder
Reviews.Content: Camera seems good, especially for the price. Problems:- If you are in "Smart Capture" there is no fill flash. That's not really a problem, it's called "ya gotta read the manual" but then again it doesn't seem smart enough to use fill flash.- 1.3 volts will indicate almost no battery left. Rechargeables are NORMALLY 1.3V, so they don't work. Even brand new alkalines at 1.55-1.6V get eaten up like candy out of a pinata. Might return it just because of this. I hate to use non-rechargeables, especially if it means constantly carrying around a bunch of extra batteries.

Reviews.Title: pretty ok camera
Reviews.Author: adolph
Reviews.Content: I open the camera and pop in the Kodak batteries that came with it, take a few pics and the batteries are dead. That wouldn't be bad if it showed low batt, or blinked or something.Got fresh batteries and worked fine. uploading pics from the camera is not as easy as it looks, and sending pics to Facebook or Flicker can be worrisome beacuse you have to grant access to those sites to Kodak for personal information. The camera is is pretty easy to use and takes nice pics. Good value, but will take some time to master all the functions.

Reviews.Title: Broke the First Day
Reviews.Author: Claudia Burrows "Claudia"
Reviews.Content: The door to the battery compartment broke the first day. The camera body is really cheap plastic and the cheap construction REALLY shows in the design of the battery door. I'm really disappointed. I had a Kodak EasyShare camera 10 years ago and it was a great camera for the price. This one...not so much. Mine's going back to Amazon today, less than 48 hours after we received it. It takes acceptable pictures and is easy enough to set up and use - hence TWO stars instead of just ONE.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Buy
Reviews.Author: Richelle R. Nurse "movie junkie"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my 11yr old god daughter in june, by mid july the camera stop working, when it comes on the background is pink and fizzy, i am trying to return it..... complete waste of money.

Reviews.Title: DURABILITY ISSUES!
Reviews.Author: P FUNK
Reviews.Content: THIS CAMERA COULD NOT SURVIVE ONE MINOR FALL. THE FASTENERS ON THE BATTERY COMPARTMENT DOOR ARE NOW BROKEN AND CAMERA IS GARBAGE. BEFORE BEING DROPPED IT WAS EASY TO USE, BUT SLOW AND UNREMARKABLE. POOR QUALITY. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: Great camera just don't buy amazon
Reviews.Author: caitlyn
Reviews.Content: This camera is great, takes really clear pictures, its small and easy to use. But you can get this same bundle from Walmart for $60, so dont spend the $120 they're trying to sell it for.

Reviews.Title: Camera broke after 1 month
Reviews.Author: J. Nielsen "Funky Monkey Photography - childr...
Reviews.Content: The camera froze with the lens out. Nothing will make it work again, new batteries, etc. My daughter got it for her birthday and on 2nd time trying it out, it stopped working. What a jip! Don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: hidious camara
Reviews.Author: P. Brown
Reviews.Content: first of all the rechargeable batteries would not charge so i had to buy others,next in less than 1 year the focus will not work period no matter what i donext the memory card i bought (4gb)will only hold 16 pics,i thought it might be thememory card so i bought another one like it and a brand new memory card will only hold 16 pics.THIS IS A TERRIBLE,TERRIBLE CAMARA AND I WILL NEVER BUY A KODAK AGAIN.if i was you i would spend the extra moneyand stay with a name brand thats been the business longer than kodak.

Reviews.Title: Y eso que es reparada !!!!
Reviews.Author: Jeffry matos
Reviews.Content: Esta camara es excelente, la compre reparada pero esta nuevaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa, no tiene ningun tipo de problema, lo unico es que no trae el CD que permite ver la camara en la pc, pero eso lo bajas de la pagina sin problemas.....

Reviews.Title: Crappy Camera
Reviews.Author: Katie H
Reviews.Content: The camera was a gift for my nieces. When it arrived, they took off the battery cover to put batteries in it & the cover snapped off, so not it is being helf on with duct tape. Also, the product description did not mention the internal memory card, so let me tell you that it only holds 2-3 pictures! You will have to immediatly get a new memory card to use the camera. Also, it runs through batteries faster than any electronic device we've ever seen! 12 pictures max & it needs two new AA batteries. While the picture quality is good, and the price is cheap, so is the camera, its just not worth the hassle.

Reviews.Title: Defective
Reviews.Author: gramps
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera for my granddaughter based on kodak reputation, camera features and price. The camera would shut off but the lens did not retract. The camera would come on but stay on for only seconds. The 2 AA batteries were fresh but replaced anyway. But this did not correct things.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: carolsch13
Reviews.Content: Bought it because of the low price, but it's not worth the money. The pictures are very poor quality and extremely blurry. You'd have to be VERY still to get a good picture. If you want better quality, you have to program the camera each time you turn it on, which is unacceptable. Where there is low quality light, the pictures are even worse, they turn reddish or yellowish. When you take a picture, you have to wait too long for the camera to be ready to take another picture. Also, you can easily touch buttons you didn't intend to while using it. Spend a little more and get something worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Question for Amazon Customer Service
Reviews.Author: PSV
Reviews.Content: I have a corporate account and just ordered a Kodak EasyShare C143 camera.  I need three of them.  One each for three different departments and it will only allow me to purchase one.  Great little cameras but I need 2 more.How can I purchase the other two that I need. Do I have to go to a different vendor at a higher price to get the other two?

Reviews.Title: I bought this camera on May 2,2011,and haven't gotten it to work
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my 10 year old son almost a month ago.He has not been able to use it. I set it up without the SD card in and it seemed to be working.When my son puts the SD card in the screen turns black and you can't do anything.I'm not sure where to go from here. I have followed the instructions to a T.We own a couple other Kodak cameras and have never had a problem.We may be returning this one.

Reviews.Title: Don't let the low price fool you
Reviews.Author: Karen H. Goodwin
Reviews.Content: I have been stupid enough to purchase this camera twice. The first time it didn't last a month. The second time it didn't last a day. This camera is cheap, but for $20 more you can buy a more dependable Canon or Nikon.

Reviews.Title: Not so EasyShare
Reviews.Author: Donald Barger "Go Blazers!"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my son thinking that it would be easy for him to use to download his pictures.  The EasyShare software is horrible.  It is not easy to use and is more about driving you to the Kodak website to buy more services.  I thought that it would be easier to just use iPhoto.  Not so fast - the camera does not mount as a drive so when I try to open it in iPhoto, it just pushes you to install the EasyShare software.  YUCK!  I guess we will be using a usb / SD connection to download pictures the hard way.I do not recommend.

Reviews.Title: Walmart sells for $69
Reviews.Author: Fighting in the BLIND GAP "dream cruizer"
Reviews.Content: This same camera in green and blue sells at Walmart for 69 dollars... so why would you buy it here at Amazon for almost 10 dollars more?HmmmPrevious review is of no help.This lens is Kodak's own brand and NOT the wonderfully precise German made: SCHNEIDER KREUZNACH VARIGON  as found on my Koday C875.COMPREHEND AND TAKE NOTE:  The lens IS the main item of a camera...get the best one you can. So when buying KODAK make sure to check lens FIRST...Kodak still offers Schneider Kreuznach lens on it's cameras...just check the writing you visually see on front of curve of lens...sometimes it will even list the SCHNEIDER KREUZNACH VARIGON in the description of the camera.

Reviews.Title: Videos don't playback with sound!
Reviews.Author: RONALD J PARKER
Reviews.Content: In order to hear the video clips, you have to download it onto a computer.  The instant playback doesn't have sound!  What a huge disappointment!  I could hardly believe it, but the detailed user guide online states very clearly that the camera will record sound but won't playback sound on the camera itself, it must be downloaded onto a computer in order to hear what you've recorded.  Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Not easy share
Reviews.Author: M. Bono
Reviews.Content: They make you think you can share the pictures straight from your camera (with internet), it doesn't work that way, you have to be connected to you own computer and have installed their software for the "easy share" to work.  If I have the pictures in my computer, sharing them is easy! I thought you could do it through Wifi or something like that.  Totally misleading.I haven't been able to install their software in my computer. When I tried to use their chat help they kept me waiting for over 20 minutes to tell me at the end they couldn't help me, and that I should take my computer to be fixed somewhere else. ALL PROGRAMS IN MY COMPUTER WORK FINE, this is the only that doesn't work, yet they could not help me!!!The pictures are fine. Nothing else!

Reviews.Title: NO SOUND!!!
Reviews.Author: laurel65
Reviews.Content: Just got this camera, and watched a short video of my grandson I had taken while experimenting with it--and there was no sound! I figured it was just me not knowing how to use it, so got on the kodak site, looked up the manual (on line only) and still couldn't find an answer. Got ahold of the customer support "chat" and was finally told that there WAS NO EXTERNAL SPEAKER, so while the sound does record onto the memory card, I am unable to hear it through my camera, and need to find a computer to stick y card in to hear what i recorded. Perhaps not an issue for some, but I just took that feature for granted as any other camera I've ever had played the SOUND through the camera. Needless to say--IT IS BEING RETURNED!! I expected alot more from kodak!

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: gdsater
Reviews.Content: Ordered green camera on Sunday evening. Left for vacation on Saturday morning and still had not received camera. When returned, camera was in mail. It was Blue! This is a camera that daughter picked out due to its price and color. Somewhat disappointed. Camera seems to work fine, haven't had time to look at quality of pictures yet.

ProductInfo.Features:
12 megapixels for high-quality pictures
3X optical zoom
2.7 in. bright LCD
One-button upload to e-mail, Kodak Gallery, YouTube, Facebook, ORKUT, and FLICKR sites
Kodak’s Smart Capture feature
ProductInfo.Name: Kodak Easyshare C143 12 MP Digital Camera with 3xOptical Zoom and 2.7-Inch LCD (Silver)
